quoteFirst: June. The tolling of the church-bell at
quoteLast: o'clock in the evening gave the signal for the attack, when the forlorn hope, consisting of three officers and sixty grenadiers in armour, sprang out of the trenches and plunged into the river, which was waist deep, and rendered difficult by large stones.
title:
Historical Record of the Sixth, or Royal First Warwickshire Regiment of Foot
Containing an Account of the Formation of the Regiment in the Year 1674, and of Its Subsequent Services to 1838
author: Cannon, Richard, 1779-1865

quoteFirst: Will be distinctly visible every evening from the first to the thirteenth of the month, setting at
quoteLast: on the evening of the former date, and at very nearly the same hour on the latter date. From the 1st to the 11th its motion is from west to east; on the 11th it is said to be stationary; however, it is actually moving in its orbit about thirty thousand miles per hour; but is approaching us in an almost direct line, and thus _seems_ to be at a stand still.
title:
The Chautauquan, Vol. 04, January 1884
A Monthly Magazine Devoted to the Promotion of True Culture.
Organ of the Chautauqua Literary and Scientific Circle.
author: Chautauqua Literary and Scientific Circle; Chautauqua Institution; Flood, Theodore L., 1842- [Editor]
